record.dc:title: 50HY5 Thompson Village Site 7HY5, Henry County, Tennessee. Feature 1, Showing fire basin and small section of floor around it. Square 17. Direction southeast.
record.wpa:narrative: This structure was wholly covered by broken burnt daub. Above this in an area confined to the limits of the structure was a layer about a half foot thick of rich black humus heavily loaded with shell, potsherds, animal bone, etc., clearly a refuse deposit. From this evidence we are led to suspect that a depression existed in which the structure stood, and that after the abandonment of the house site the depression was used as a garbage dump. This evidence occurs repeatedly in other houses on the site and will be discussed again as it arises.
record.wpa:comments: There are two house forms on file for this photograph with different narrative information for each one. Additional narrative information on file at the institution.
